topic_explorer-default_description: Search or Browse questions and pick one to see answers
metrics-total-page-views-description: Page views on Wikimedia projects count the viewing of article content. In this data we try to exclude bot traffic and focus on human user page views
metrics-total-page-views-tooltip: A page view is a request for the content of a web page. Page views on Wikimedia projects is our most important content consumption metric. The pageview definition tries to count pageviews of content delivered to users.
metrics-total-page-views-question: How many times are articles viewed?
metrics-legacy-page-views-description: Legacy page views are the predecessor of page views. They include data from January 2008 to July 2016.
metrics-legacy-page-views-tooltip: Legacy page views on Wikimedia projects count the viewing of article content from January 2008 to July 2016. The main difference compared to current page view data is the lack of filtering of self-reported bots, thus automated and human traffic are reported together.
metrics-legacy-page-views-question: How many times are articles viewed prior to current page view definition?
metrics-page-views-by-country-descriptio: Countries where this project is visited the most. Those countries with less than 100 views are not reported and are blank in the map
metrics-page-views-by-country-tooltip: A page view is a request for the content of a web page. Page views on Wikimedia projects is our most important content consumption metric. The pageview definition tries to count pageviews of content delivered to users
metrics-page-views-by-country-question: Where are the project's visitors coming from?
metrics-unique-devices-description: How many distinct devices we have visiting a project in a given time period
metrics-unique-devices-tooltip: Unique Devices metric tell us how many distinct devices we have visiting our web properties in a given time period. The Analytics team counts unique devices per project per day and month in a way that does not uniquely identify, fingerprint or otherwise track users.
metrics-unique-devices-question: How many unique devices access content?
metrics-top-viewed-articles-tooltip: A page view is a request for the content of a web page. Page views on Wikimedia projects is our most important content consumption metric. The pageview definition tries to count pageviews of content delivered to users
metrics-top-viewed-articles-question: What are the most viewed articles?
metrics-editors-description: The count of editors with one or more edits, including on redirect pages
metrics-editors-tooltip: The count of editors with one or more edits, including on redirect pages.
metrics-active-editors-description: The count of editors with five or more edits, including on redirect pages
metrics-active-editors-tooltip: The count of editors with five or more edits, including on redirect pages.
metrics-active-editors-question: How many active editors are there?
metrics-edits-description: The count of edits (or revisions), including edits on redirects
metrics-edits-tooltip: The count of edits (or revisions), including edits on redirects.
metrics-edits-question: How many edits have been made?
metrics-user-edits-description: The count of edits (or revisions) made by human users
metrics-user-edits-tooltip: The count of edits (or revisions) by users, including edits on redirects.
metrics-user-edits-question: How many edits have been made by users?
metrics-new-pages-description: The count of new pages created, excluding pages being redirects
metrics-new-pages-tooltip: The count of new pages created, excluding pages being redirects. We measure this by adding up the creations and restores of old pages, and subtracting the page deletions for a given month.
metrics-new-pages-question: How many new pages each month?
metrics-new-registered-users-description: The count of newly self-created registered users
metrics-new-registered-users-tooltip: Number of new users signing up on a given wiki project for the first time. Used as a proxy for user acquisition.
metrics-new-registered-users-question: How many new users are there?
metrics-top-editors-tooltip: Editors ranked by number of edits.
metrics-top-editors-question: Who are the users that edit the most articles?
metrics-top-edited-pages-tooltip: Pages ranked by number of edits.
metrics-top-edited-pages-question: Which are the pages with the most edits?
metrics-absolute-bytes-diff-description: The sum of the absolute differences in bytes made by each edit (or revision), including edits on redirects. In other words, counting negative differences as positive
metrics-absolute-bytes-diff-tooltip: The sum of the absolute differences in bytes made by each edit (or revision), including edits on redirects. In other words, counting negative differences as positive.
metrics-absolute-bytes-diff-question: What are the total number of bytes added and removed?
metrics-edited-pages-description: The number of pages edited, excluding redirect pages
metrics-edited-pages-tooltip: The number of pages edited, excluding redirect pages.
metrics-net-bytes-difference-description: The sum of the differences in bytes made by each edit (or revision), including edits on redirects
metrics-net-bytes-difference-tooltip: The sum of the differences in bytes made by each edit (or revision), including edits on redirects.
metrics-net-bytes-difference-question: How did the overall size in bytes change since last period?
metrics-pages-to-date-description: The running count of all pages created, excluding pages being redirects
metrics-pages-to-date-tooltip: The running count of all pages created, excluding pages being redirects. We measure this by adding up the creations and restores of old pages, and subtracting the page deletions for a given month.
metrics-pages-to-date-question: How many pages are there in the project right now?
metrics-total-mediarequests-description: The total amount of requests directed to media files such as image, video and audio
metrics-total-mediarequests-tooltip: The total amount of requests directed to media files such as image, video and audio.
metrics-total-mediarequests-question: How many times were media files requested?
metrics-top-mediarequests-description: A list of the most requested media files, split by file type
metrics-top-mediarequests-tooltip: The total amount of requests directed to media files such as image, video and audio.
metrics-top-mediarequests-question: Which are the most popular media files?
graph_panel-change_cant_calculate: % change cannot be calculated over this time range.
graph_panel-wikistats1_counterpart: This metric is filtered to match its Wikistats 1 counterpart.
graph_panel-annotations_link_action: see or add annotations for this data on this wiki article.
metrics_matrix-wikistats1-info: Metrics marked with the Wikimedia logo have the same filtering and parameters as the ones shown in Wikistats 1.
metrics_matrix-wikistats1-learn_more: Learn more about the differences between the old and new Wikistats metrics
footer-copyright: All data, charts, and other content is available under the {license}
tooltip-help-maximize: Hide the side panel and make the graph bigger
tooltip-help-download: Download the data you are viewing
tooltip-help-split: Split the total into parts to see more detail.  Filter to the parts you're interested in using the checkboxes
tooltip-wikistats1Metric: This is a Wikistats 1 metric. Click here to go to the legacy version.
tooltip-filterAndSplit: Split up the total into different categories, and hide one or more categories
tooltip-breakdown-desktop: The site intended for desktop devices (may be viewed on mobile devices)
tooltip-breakdown-mobile-app: Any of the Wikimedia native mobile apps
tooltip-breakdown-mobile-web: The site intended for mobile devices (may be viewed on desktop devices)
tooltip-breakdown-mobile-site: The site intended for mobile devices (may be viewed on desktop devices)
tooltip-breakdown-desktop-site: The site intended for desktop devices (may be viewed on mobile devices)
tooltip-breakdown-anonymous: A user that has not logged in
tooltip-breakdown-group-bot: A bot that is registered and part of the bot user group
tooltip-breakdown-name-bot: A user that has a name which contains "bot" (note that this could include names like BottlenoseDolphin)
tooltip-breakdown-spider: A computer program that crawls through sites to index them, generally web search engines
tooltip-breakdown-bot: A computer program automatically requesting a page
tooltip-breakdown-content: Also referred to as "Main Namespace", includes articles in namespace zero and and a few others
tooltip-breakdown-non-content: Talk pages, user pages, etc. are called Non Content
tooltip-breakdown-1..4-edits: Made between 1 and 4 edits in each month or day shown
tooltip-breakdown-5..24-edits: Made between 5 and 24 edits in each month or day shown
tooltip-breakdown-25..99-edits: Made between 25 and 99 edits in each month or day shown
tooltip-breakdown-100..-edits: Made 100 or more edits in each month or day shown
status_overlay-no_data: There is no data available for this date range on this project
status_overlay-non_global: The {metricName} metric is not available for all projects. Select a specific wiki
status_overlay-non_global_family: The {metricName} metric is not available for {project}. Select a specific wiki
status_overlay-no_service: The analytics query service seems to be down
